other_tests.changes_over_time: Isolates identified as Bacillus anthracis by PCR on 21 February 2006.

other_tests.findings: 1700 mL of serosanguineous fluid with WBC count of 110 cells/mL.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No organisms were observed on Gram staining; bacterial culture of the fluid was sterile.

other_tests.findings: Immunohistochemical evidence of Bacillus anthracis antigens.

other_tests.procedure_name: Lethal factor (LF) and anti-protective antigen (PA) IgG level testing
other_tests.findings: LF detectable in plasma (294.30 ng/mL) and serum (203.0 ng/mL).
other_tests.changes_over_time: LF levels decreased steadily from 294.30 to 0.85 ng/mL by 23 February; anti-PA IgG reached max value (311.4 mg/mL) on 28 February.
Initial decline in LF levels; serum LF transiently increased before declining again.
